legendaryGroup.name: Aboleth Sovereign
lairActions: When fighting inside its lair, an aboleth can invoke the ambient magic to take lair actions. On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the aboleth takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects:

items: The aboleth sovereign casts {@spell phantasmal force} (no components required) on any number of creatures it can see within 60 feet of it. While maintaining concentration on this effect, the aboleth can't take other lair actions.

Pools of water within 150 feet of the aboleth sovereign surge outward in a grasping tide. Any creature on the ground within 20 feet of such a pool must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 20 feet into the water and {@condition restrained} until the end of their next turn. The aboleth can't use this lair action again until it has used a different one.

Water in the aboleth sovereign's lair becomes momentarily charged with psychic energy. The aboleth sovereign can target any number of creatures it can see in such water within 150 feet of it. A target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) psychic damage and become {@condition paralyzed} until the end of their next turn. The aboleth can't use this lair action again until it has used a different one.

regionalEffects: The region containing an aboleth's lair is warped by the creature's presence, which creates one or more of the following effects:

items: Underground surfaces within 1 mile of the aboleth's lair are slimy and wet and are difficult terrain.
Water sources within 1 mile of the lair are supernaturally fouled. Enemies of the aboleth that drink such water vomit it within minutes.

As an action, the aboleth can create an illusory image of itself within 1 mile of the lair. The copy can appear at any location the aboleth has seen before or in any location a creature {@condition charmed} by the aboleth can currently see. Once created, the image lasts for as long as the aboleth maintains concentration, as if concentrating on a spell. Although the image is intangible, it looks, sounds, and can move like the aboleth. The aboleth can sense, speak, and use telepathy from the image's position as if present at that position. If the image takes any damage, it disappears.

regionalEffects: If the aboleth dies, the first two effects fade over the course of {@dice 3d10} days.

disease.name: Adlet Bloodlust
entries: Symptoms manifest after {@dice 1d4} hours, and they include nausea, disorientation, and the unwavering desire to eat humanoid flesh. The infected creature gains one level of {@condition exhaustion} that can't be removed until the disease is cured. If the infected creature attempts to consume food other than humanoid flesh or drink anything besides humanoid blood, it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or immediately vomit up whatever it consumed, gaining no nutritional value from it.

At the end of each long rest, an infected creature can make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the DC for this save and the save to avoid vomiting are decreased by ({@dice 1d4}). When the saving throw DC drops to 0, the creature is cured.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The deva's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}). The deva can innately cast the following spells, requiring only verbal components:

trait.name: Angelic Weapons
entries: The deva's weapon attacks are magical. When the deva hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@dice 4d8} radiant damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The deva has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Divine Enemy
entries: When the deva hits a fiend or undead with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 1d8} radiant damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The deva makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) radiant damage.

action.name: Healing Touch (3/Day)
entries: The deva touches another creature. The target magically regains 20 ({@dice 4d8 + 2}) hit points and is freed from any curse, disease, poison, blindness, or deafness.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: The deva magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating equal to or less than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the deva's choice).

In a new form, the deva retains its game statistics and ability to speak, but its AC, movement modes, Strength, Dexterity, and special senses are replaced by those of the new form, and it gains any statistics and capabilities (except class features, legendary actions, and lair actions) that the new form has but that it lacks.
A movanic deva is a soldier angel tasked with fighting undead and fiends throughout the planes.

trait.name: Dive Attack
entries: If the aarakocra is flying and dives at least 30 ft. straight toward a target and then hits it with a melee weapon attack, the attack deals an extra 14 ({@dice 4d6}) damage to the target, and the next attack roll made against the target before the end of the aarakocra's next turn has advantage.

action.name: Lance
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) piercing damage. If this attack is made against a target within 5 feet of the aarakocra, the attack has disadvantage

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Skirmisher
entries: The aarakocra can take the Disengage action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

action.name: Longbow

trait.name: Blessing of Aerdrie
entries: The aarakocra's staff attacks deal and additional {@dice 1d8} thunder damage, included in the attack. When the aarakocra hits a creature with their staff, they can use their bonus action and expend a spell slot of 1st level or higher to deal an additional {@dice 2d8} thunder damage. If a spell slot of 2nd level or higher is expended, the extra damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot above 1st.

action.name: Animate Air (1/day)
entries: The aarakocra forms an air elemental in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of it. It acts as an ally to its creator, and follows their commands (no action required). The elemental remains for 1 hour, until its creator dies, or until its creator dismisses it as an action.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The aarakocra priest of aerdrie is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). The aarakocra priest of aerdrie has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The aboleth can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Mucous Cloud
entries: While underwater, the aboleth is surrounded by transformative mucus. A creature that touches the aboleth or that hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it must make a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature is diseased for {@dice 1d4} hours. The diseased creature can breathe only underwater, and has disadvantage on Constitution saving throws.

trait.name: Probing Telepathy
entries: If a creature communicates telepathically with the aboleth, the aboleth learns the creature's greatest desires if the aboleth can see the creature.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The aboleth makes four tentacle attacks. It can use psychic blast in place of any tentacle attack.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or become diseased. The disease has no effect for 1 minute and can be removed by any magic that cures disease. After 1 minute, the diseased creature's skin becomes translucent and slimy, the creature can't regain hit points unless it is underwater, and the disease can be removed only by heal or another disease-curing spell of 6th level or higher. When the creature is outside a body of water, it takes 13 ({@damage 2d12}) acid damage every 10 minutes unless moisture is applied to the skin before 10 minutes have passed.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is Large of smaller, the aboleth soveriegn can choose to push it up to 10 feet away.

action.name: Psychic Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 10} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) psychic damage and the target can't take reactions untill the start of their next turn. If the target is reduced to 0 hit points by this attack, the aboleth soveriegn regains a number of hit points equal to the damage dealt.

action.name: Enslave
entries: The aboleth targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or be magically {@condition charmed} by the aboleth until the aboleth dies or until it is on a different plane of existence from the target. The {@condition charmed} target is under the aboleth's control and can't take reactions, and the aboleth and the target can communicate telepathically with each other over any distance.

Whenever the {@condition charmed} target takes damage, the target can repeat the saving throw. On a success, the effect ends. No more than once every 24 hours, the target can also repeat the saving throw when it is at least 10 miles away from the aboleth.

entries: If the adlet has advantage on a melee on a weapon attack, it can choose to make that attack without advantage. If it does so and still hits its target, the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 12}).

entries: The adlet has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The adlet has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the adlet's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage. If the target is {@condition grappled} by the adlet or one of the adlet's allies, the adlet can make a bite attack against it as a bonus action

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage and the adlet regains hit points equal to the damage dealt.

variant.name: Adlet Bloodlust
entries: Occasionally, an adlet's bite can transmit a disease known as adlet bloodlust. Whenever a humanoid is hit by the adlet's bite attack, or if it is bitten by an infected humanoid, it must succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or become infected with this disease. On a successful save, a creature is immune to the disease's transmission for the next 24 hours.

entries: The ahklut can use its action to polymorph into a form that resembles a Large wolf (speed 50 ft.), a Huge orca (speed 0 ft., swim 90 feet), or its true form, which is a Huge wolf-orca hybrid. Its statistics, other than its size and speed, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

Its statistics are the same in each form, except it has an AC of 13 and the speed changes noted. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is transformed with it. It reverts back to its true form if it dies.

entries: While the staff remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal staff.

action.name: Staff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The animator's staff is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Constitution (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). The animator's staff has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
entries: The wand is {@condition incapacitated} while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the wand must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the wand remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal wand.

action.name: Poke
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 0} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The animator's wand is a 2th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Constitution (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). The animator's wand has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
entries: The caltrop is {@condition incapacitated} while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the caltrop must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the caltrop remains motionless and isn't flying, it is indistinguishable from a normal caltrop.

action.name: Pierce
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
entries: The shield is {@condition incapacitated} while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the shield must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the shield remains motionless and isn't flying, it is indistinguishable from a normal shield.

action.name: Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Protect
entries: The shield imposes disadvantage on an attack roll that targets a target other than the shield that is within 5 feet of the shield.

trait.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
entries: The sack is {@condition incapacitated} while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the sack must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute.

trait.name: Damage Transfer
entries: While attached to a creature, the sack takes only half the damage dealt to it, and the creature the sack is attached to takes the other half.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the sack remains motionless and isn't flying, it is indistinguishable from a normal sack.

action.name: Smother
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage and ifthe target is Large or smaller, the sack attaches to the target's head, and the target is {@condition blinded} and unable to breathe while the sack is attached. While attached, the sack can make this attack only against the target and has advantage on the attack roll. A creature, including the target, can take its action to detach the sack by succeeding on a {@dc 12} Strength check.

trait.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
entries: The caltrops are {@condition incapacitated} while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the caltrops must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the caltrops remains motionless and isn't flying, they is indistinguishable from normal caltrops.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny caltrop. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Pierces
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) piercing damage or 7 ({@dice 2d6}) if the swarm is at half hit points or fewer. Additionaly, the target's walking speed is reduced by 10 feet until the end of their next turn.

trait.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
entries: The ball bearings are {@condition incapacitated} while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by ball bearings, the caltrops must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the ball bearings remains motionless and isn't flying, they are indistinguishable from normal ball bearings.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny ball bearing. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Bludgeon
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) bludgeoning damage or 7 ({@dice 2d6}) if the swarm is at half hit points or fewer.

action.name: Roll
entries: The swarm of ball bearings moves up to its speed. While doing so, it can enter creature's spaces. Whenever the ball bearings enter a creature's space, the creature must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage, or 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage if the swarm has half hit points or fewer, and is knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Acidic Blood
entries: A creature that hits the ankheg with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) acid damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ankheg can make three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) acid damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Until this grapple ends, the ankheg can bite only the {@condition grappled} creature and has advantage on attack rolls to do so.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). The ankheg can have up to 2 creatures {@condition grappled} in this way at once.

action.name: Acid Spray {@recharge}
entries: The ankheg spits acid in a line that is 30 ft. long and 5 ft. wide, provided that it has no creature {@condition grappled}. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 24 ({@damage 7d6}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Heated Body
entries: A creature that touches the azer or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage.

trait.name: Heated Weapons
entries: When the azer hits with a metal melee weapon, it deals an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The azer sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 ft..

trait.name: Master Crafted Weapons
entries: The azer's weapons are masterfully crafted. Their warhammer is a +1 weapon (included in the attack), and it has four charges, which are regained at dawn. The azer can expend on of the charges to cast the following spells as a 2nd level spell: {@spell aganazzar's scorcher}, {@spell flaming sphere}, {@spell pyrotechnics}, or {@spell scorching ray}. (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks)

action.name: Warhammer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, or 9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack, plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage.

trait.name: Heated Body
entries: A creature that touches the azer or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage.

trait.name: Heated Weapons
entries: When the azer hits with a metal melee weapon, it deals an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The azer sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 ft..

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The azer makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Warhammer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Leadership (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: For 1 minute, the azer can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a {@dice d4} to its roll provided it can hear and understand the azer. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the azer is {@condition incapacitated}.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The azer adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the azer must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Dream Sense
entries: The baku can magicly sense the presence of sleeping creatures up to 1 mile away. The baku knows the general direction they're in but not their exact locations.

trait.name: Unsleeping
entries: The baku cannot be magically put to sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The baku makes three attacks: two with its claws and one with its gore.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Sleeping Mist (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The baku releases a white mist from its trunk, which then spreads over a 20-foor radius sphere centered on the baku. The sphere spreads around corners, and its area is lightly obscured. It lasts for minute or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it.

Each creature that is completely within the cloud at the start of its turn must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or fall {@condition unconscious} until they take damage or another creature uses an action to shake or slap them awake. Once they awaken, they become immune to the magic of that particular mist.

action.name: Consume Dreams/Nightmares
entries: The baku consumes the dreams or nightmares of one {@condition unconscious} creature within 5 feet of it, sucking them up through its trunk.

If it chooses to consume a creature's dreams, the target must make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw. It takes 55 ({@damage 10d10}) pyschic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. Either way, it gains a level of {@condition exhaustion}.
If it chooses to consume a creature's nightmares, the target regains 35 ({@dice 10d6}) hit points, and loses a level of {@condition exhaustion}.
Once the baku uses either of these actions on a creature, that creature cannot be targeted again until 24 hours have elapsed.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The baku's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 11}). The baku can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Detect Life
entries: The bewailer can magically sense the presence of living creatures up to 5 miles away that aren't undead or constructs. She knows the general direction they're in but not their exact locations.

trait.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: The bewailer can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The bewailer can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. She takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if she ends her turn inside an object.

trait.name: Timed Etherealness
entries: The bewailer is trapped in the ethereal plane during all times of the day except the time period within 1 hour of her death. During this time, if the bewailer is on the Ethereal Plane at the start of her turn, she is immedialy transported to the Material Plane. At the end of this 2-hour period, she forcibly returns to the Ethereal Plane

action.name: Corrupting Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}31 ({@damage 8d6 + 3}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Horrifying Visage
entries: The bewailer enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, and leaves behind an illusiory double where she was on the Material Plane. If this double is within 5 feet of a creature when it appears, it feigns a corrupting touch attack against that creature. The attack always appears to miss.

The illusiory double lasts until the start of the bewailer remains in the ethereal plane for as long as the double lasts. It has all the same statistics as the bewailer, except it has 1 hit point. If reduced to 0 hit points, the illusiory duplicate explodes in a burst of necrotic energy. Each creature within 5 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 21 ({@damage 6d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Horrifying Visage
entries: Each non-undead creature within 60 feet of the bewailer that can see her must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the bewailer is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the bewailer's Horrifying Visage for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Wail {@recharge}
entries: The bewailer releases a mournful wail. This wail has no effect on constructs and undead. All other creatures within 30 feet of her that can hear her must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature drops to 0 hit points. On a success, a creature takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage. Creatures that have already made this save within the last 24 hours have advantage on the roll.

trait.name: Petrifying Gaze
entries: If a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the basilisk and the two of them can see each other, the basilisk can force the creature to make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw if the basilisk isn't {@condition incapacitated} and can see the creature. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is instantly {@condition petrified}. Otherwise, the creature begins to turn to stone and is {@condition restrained}. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is {@condition petrified} until freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.

A creature that isn't surprised can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If it does so, it can't see the basilisk until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If it looks at the basilisk in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.
The basilisk does not target itself with its gaze.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The basilisk makes two melee attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage. if the target is a creature, it must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 24 ({@damage 7d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Spit Poison
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 25/50 ft., one creature. {@h}17 ({@damage 5d6}) poison damage. The target and each creature within 5 feet of it must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 17 ({@damage 5d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The basilisk can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Petrifying Gaze
entries: If a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the basilisk and the two of them can see each other, the basilisk can force the creature to make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw if the basilisk isn't {@condition incapacitated}. On a failed save, the creature magically begins to turn to stone and is {@condition restrained}. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is {@condition petrified} until freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.

A creature that isn't surprised can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If it does so, it can't see the basilisk until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If it looks at the basilisk in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.
If the basilisk sees its reflection within 30 feet of it in bright light, it mistakes itself for a rival and targets itself with its gaze.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Petrifying Water {@recharge 5}
entries: The basilisk unleashes a torrent of water from its mouth that is 15 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or 14 ({@damage 4d6}) bludgeoning damage and suffer the same effect as if they had failed the save against the basilisk's petrifying gaze. If the creatures are underwater, they have disadvantage on the save.

trait.name: Charged
entries: When the behir uses its breath weapons, its body becomes charged with lightning until the end of its next turn. For the duration, the behir can take the Dash action as a bonus action, its melee weapon attacks do 4 ({@dice 1d8}) additional lightning damage on a hit, and any creature that starts its turn {@condition grappled} by the behir takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) lightning damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The behir makes four attacks: three with its claws and one to constrict. The behir can make a single bite attack in place of the three claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) piercing damage. If its breath weapon is availble, the behir can use its shocking blast as a bonus action, forcing the target it bit to make the save at disadvantage.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one Large or smaller creature. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage plus 18 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) slashing damage. The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}) if the behir isn't already constricting a creature, and the target is {@condition restrained} until this grapple ends.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d8 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Breath Weapons {@recharge 5}
entries: The behir uses one of the following breath weapons.

items.name: Lightning Breath.
items.entry: The behir exhales lightning in a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 66 ({@damage 12d10}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Shocking Blast.
items.entry: The behir exhales a ball of concentration lightning that travels along a line 5 feet wide and 30 feet long. The first creature on that line must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature 33 ({@damage 6d10}) lightning damage and is {@condition stunned} until the end of the end of the behir's next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and suffers no secondary effect.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The beholder can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Cone Of Light
entries: The beholder's central eye emits a 20-foot cone of magical light. At the start of each of its turns, the beholder decides which way the cone faces and whenever the cone is active. Any creature that starts its turn in the area that can see must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition blinded} until the start of their next turn.

A creature that isn't suprised can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. if it does so, it can't see the beholder until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If it looks at the beholder in the meantime, it must immedialy make the save.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The beholder makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws. It can use Eye Rays in place of its bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d6 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 2d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Eye Rays
entries: The beholder shoots two of the following magical eye rays at {@dice 1d4|random} (reroll duplicates), choosing up to two targets it can see within 120 feet of it:
1. {@i Enervation Ray.} The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

2. {@i Pushing Ray.} The target creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 15 feet directly away from the beholder and have its speed halved until the start of the beholder's next turn.

3. {@i Paralyzing Ray.} The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

4. {@i Sleep Ray.} The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or fall asleep and remain {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute. The target awakens if it takes damage or another creature takes an action to wake it. This ray has no effect on constructs and undead.

trait.name: Death Burst
entries: When the blight dies, it leaves behind a cloud of poison that fills a 5-foot cube centered on its space. The area is lightly obscured, and any creature that starts its turn there must make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} until the start of their next turn. On a successful one, a creature takes half damage and is not {@condition poisoned}. Wind disperses the cloud, which otherwise lasts for 1 minute.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the blight remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a mas of dead branches.

trait.name: Poisonous Weapons
entries: In the blight's hand, its weapon deals an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage and applies the {@condition poisoned} condition (included in the attack).

action.name: Pike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage, and the target is {@condition poisoned} until the end of their next turn.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the blight remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a mas of branches.

action.name: Branch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and a Large or smaller creature is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the blight can't grappe another target.

action.name: Crush
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target {@condition grappled} by the blight. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Smash
entries: The blight smashes down with a mass of branches that is 10 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or take 13 ({@damage 3d8}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Primal Rage (1/day)
entries: As a reaction to taking damage, the blight begins to fight with primal ferocity. For one minute, the blight has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage, has a speed of 30 feet, and has advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. At the end of each of the blight's turns, and the rage ends if the blight hasn't attacked a hostile creature or taken damage since the end of their last turn.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the bugbear hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Precise Attacker
entries: The bugbear's weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 18-20. When the bugbear scores a critical hit, it rolls the damage dice three times, instead of twice.

trait.name: Surprise Attack
entries: If the bugbear suprises a creature during the first round of combat, the bugbear has advantage on the first attack roll against that creature. If the attack hits, it is considered a critical hit.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bugbear makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage or 15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) slashing damage if wielded with two hands.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the bugbear hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Surprise Attack
entries: If the bugbear surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage from the attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bugbear makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Morningstar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The bugbear champion of hruggek is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). The bugbear champion of hruggek has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The bullywug can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Speak with Frogs and Toads
entries: The bullywug can communicate simple concepts to frogs and toads when it speaks in Bullywug.

trait.name: Swamp Camouflage
entries: The bullywug has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in swampy terrain.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The bullywug's long jump is up to 20 ft. and its high jump is up to 10 ft., with or without a running start.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bullywug makes three melee attacks: one with its bite and two with its maul.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Maul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The bullywug can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Speak with Frogs and Toads
entries: The bullywug can communicate simple concepts to frogs and toads when it speaks in Bullywug.

trait.name: Swamp Camouflage
entries: The bullywug has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in swampy terrain.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The bullywug's long jump is up to 20 ft. and its high jump is up to 10 ft., with or without a running start.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bullywug makes two melee attacks: one with its bite and one with its spear.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage, or 6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Blowgun
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 25/100 ft., one target. {@h}1 piercing damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage and become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. If its saving throw result is 5 or lower, the {@condition poisoned} target falls {@condition unconscious} for the same duration, or until it takes damage or another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The bullywug can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Speak with Frogs and Toads
entries: The bullywug can communicate simple concepts to frogs and toads when it speaks in Bullywug.

trait.name: Swamp Camouflage
entries: The bullywug has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in swampy terrain.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The bullywug's long jump is up to 20 ft. and its high jump is up to 10 ft., with or without a running start.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bullywug makes two melee attacks: one with its bite and one with its staff.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Staff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit ({@hit 5} to hit with shillelagh), reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage with shillelagh.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The druid is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following druid spells prepared:

trait.name: Fiendish Blessing
entries: The AC of the alu-fiend includes its Charisma bonus.

trait.name: Foresight
entries: the alu-fiend cannot be surprised, and adds its Charisma bonus to its initiative rolls.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cambion makes two melee attacks or uses its Fire Ray twice.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Fiendish Charm
entries: One humanoid the cambion can see within 30 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or be magically {@condition charmed} for 1 day. The {@condition charmed} target obeys the cambion's spoken commands. If the target suffers any harm from the cambion or another creature or receives a suicidal command from the cambion, the target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful, or if the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the cambion's Fiendish Charm for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Fiendish Transposition {@recharge 4}
entries: The alu-fiend unleashes a blast of fire, and each other creature within 5 feet of the alu-fiend must suceed on a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage. It then teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 15 feet of it.
If this teleport places the alu-fiend within 5 feet of a creature, the alu-fiend can make one attack with its greatsword against that creature.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The alu-fiend's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}). The alu-fiend can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The spwan can use its action to polymorph into a form that resembles a Medium humanoid, or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form, and any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

trait.name: Alluring Appearance
entries: Any humanoid that starts its turn within 30 feet of the spawn and can see the spawn's true form must make a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition charmed} by the spawn for 1 minute, ending early if the spawn harms them in any way. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the spawn's Alluring Appearance for the next 24 hours.

Unless the target is suprised or the revelation of hte spawn's true form sudden, the target can avert its eyes and avoid making the inital saving throw. Until the start of its next turn, a creature that averts its eyes has disadvantage on attack rolls against the spawn.

trait.name: Fiendish Blessing
entries: The AC of the spawn includes its Charisma bonus.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The spawn has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The spawn's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The spawn makes two melee attacks with its greatsword.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Teleport
entries: The spawn magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The spawn makes an attack with its greatsword.

legendary.name: Direct
entries: The spwan forces one creature {@condition charmed} by it to move up to its speed to a location of the spawns choice, using its reaction. If this movement harms the creature, such as provoking an opportunity attack, the charm ends after the movement completes.

legendary.name: Teleport
entries: The spawn uses its teleport action.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The spawn of graz'zt's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}). The spawn of graz'zt can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Fiendish Blessing
entries: The AC of the spawn includes its Charisma bonus.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the spawn fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The spawn has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The spawn's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The spawn makes one attack with its greatsword and one with its tail.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 4d6 + 6}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) slashing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage.

legendary.name: Cast
entries: The spawn casts one of its at-will spells.

legendary.name: Cleave (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The spawn cleaves in a wide arc with its greatsword, and each creature in a 10 foot cone originating from the spawn must succeed ion a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw or take 20 ({@damage 4d6 + 6}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The spawn's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}). The spawn can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The tangle crawler has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The tangle crawler can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Writhing Tentacles
entries: Other creatures provoke opportunity attacks when they enter the reach of the tangle crawler's tentacles.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The tangle crawler makes two attacks: one with its tentacles and one with its bite.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 5 ({@damage 2d4}) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. Until this poison ends, the target is {@condition paralyzed}. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the poison on itself on a success.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 3d4 + 4}) piercing damage. If the tangle crawler scores a critical hit, it can choose to deal no additional damage, and instead regain 7 ({@dice 3d4}) hit points.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The centaur has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the centaur moves at least 30 ft. straight toward a target and then hits it with a lance attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Head Start
entries: On its first turn of combat, the centaur can take the dash action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The centaur has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Mobile
entries: Opportunity attacks against the centaur are made at disadvantage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The centaur makes two attacks: one with its lance and one with its hooves or two with its javelins. It then uses its Knight's Command.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or fall {@condition prone}.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Lane
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d12 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Knight's Command
entries: An allied creature within 120 feet of the centaur that can hear it can use their reaction to move up to half their speed and make one weapon attack.

action.name: Leadership (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: For 1 minute, the centaur can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a {@dice d4} to its roll provided it can hear and understand the knight. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the centaur is {@condition incapacitated}.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: When another creature within 5 feet of the centaur is hit by an attack, the centaur can add 3 to the creature's AC against that attack. To do so, the centaur must see the attacker and be wielding a shield.

trait.name: Curving Shot
entries: I the centaur misses with a longbow attack, it can immediately use its bonus action to attempt to magiclly curve the shot, potentially hitting another target. The centaur rerolls the attack roll, targeting a different creature that is within a 30-foor cone behind the original target.

trait.name: Kicking Retreat
entries: If the centaur attacks with its hooves, it can take the Disengage action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Magical Arrows
entries: The centaur's attacks with its longbow are magical, and deal an additional {@dice 1d8} damage on a hit (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The centaur makes two attacks with its longbow or one with its longbow and one with its hooves

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 3d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The lamia's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components.

trait.name: Invigorate
entries: As a bonus action, the centaur can expend one of its hit dice to cause the spirit summoned with Spirit Summon action to regain 10 ({@dice 1d10 + 5}) hit points. If the spirit was reduced to 0 hit points within the last minute, this action can revive it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The centaur makes two attacks with its spear and one with its hooves.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage if wielded with two hands.

action.name: Summon Spirit (Recharges After A Long Rest)
entries: The centaur summons a spirit that takes the form of a {@filter beast of CR 1 or lower|bestiary|type=beast|challenge rating=[&0;&1]} in a space within 30 feet of it. The spirit is an ally of the centaur, and acts on the turn directly after its summoner in the imitative order. It remains until it or its summoner dies, or until it is dismissed as an action.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The centaur spiritcaller is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). The centaur spiritcaller has the following ranger spells prepared:

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While not wearing armor, the centaur adds it Constitution modifier to its AC.

trait.name: Unflinching
entries: The centaur is immune to being {@condition frightened} or {@condition charmed}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The centaur makes two attacks with its battleaxe and one with its hooves.

action.name: Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Rampage {@recharge 4}
entries: The centaur moves up to its speed and makes up four attacks with its battleaxes, each against a different creature. It also gains resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage until the start of its next turn upon hitting a creature with this action.

trait.name: After-Image
entries: When the cerynitis starts to move for the first time on its turn, it can choose to leave behind a golden image of itself at the location it was at the start of its turn, and any creature that touches it while it remains in place takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) radiant damage.

At the start of the cerynitis's next turn, the image streaks along a 10-foor wide line that traces the path the cerynitis took on its last turn. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Blurred Movement
entries: Attack rolls against the cerynitis have disadvantage unless the cerynitis is {@condition incapacitated} or {@condition restrained}.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the cerynitis moves at least 30 ft. straight toward a target and then hits it with an antlers attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 3 ({@dice 1d6}) damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the cerynitis can make one hooves attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the cerynitis is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the assassin instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Limited Incorporeality
entries: As a bonus action, the cerynitis can become temporarily incorporeal as its body transforms into golden light. For the next 10 feet of its movement it can move through other creatures and objects. If it ends its turn inside an object, it takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) force damage.

trait.name: Nimble
entries: The cerynitis can take the disengage action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cerynitis uses its golden radiance if available. It then makes three attacks:

action.name: Antlers
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d6 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 8} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d10}) radiant damage.

action.name: Golden Radiance {@recharge 4}
entries: The cerynitis's antlers begin to glow with golden light. Until the end of the turn, any creature hit by the cerynitis's antlers must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) radiant damage and is {@condition blinded}. On a successful save, they take half as much damage and are not {@condition blinded}

trait.name: Astral Jaunt
entries: As a bonus action on its turn, the chimera can transport itself to the astral plane, or back to the plane it was on last. When it transports itself in this way, it returns to a location within 30 feet of where it was the last time it was in whichever plane it's transporting itself to.

trait.name: Two Heads
entries: The chimera has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks and on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.

trait.name: Wakeful
entries: When one of the ettin's heads is asleep, its other head is awake.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The chimera makes four attacks: two with its bite, and two with its claws. It can use its mind blast in place of any bite attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) pyschic damage. If the target is hit by two bite attacks on the same turn, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of the chimera until the end of the chimera's next turn.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) slashing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) pyschic damage.

action.name: Mind Blast
entries: One creature within 60 feet of the chimera must make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw. The creature takes 16 ({@damage 3d10}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The astral chimera's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}). The astral chimera can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the demimaera moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a target and then hits it with a horns attack on the same turn, the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the demimaera can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The chimera makes three attacks: one with its bite, one with its horns, and one with its snake tail. When its fire breath is available, it can use the breath in place of its bite and horns.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Horns
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Snake Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage, and if the target is a creature, it must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Fire Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon head exhales fire in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 5d8}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Fiendish Strikes
entries: At the start of each of the maeragorgon's turns,roll a {@dice d4}. The maeragorgon gains an effect depending on the number rolled, as discribed below:
1: No effect.
2: Until the end of the turn, the maeragorgon's claws become wreathed in flame. For the duration claw attacks deals an additional 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage on a hit.

3: Until the end of the turn, the maeragorgon's horns become coated with ice. For the duration claw attacks deals an additional 3 ({@damage 1d6}) cold damage on a hit, and causes the target's speed to be reduced by 10 feet until the end of their next turn.

4: Until the end of the turn, the maeragorgon's dragon mouth becomes coated in a deadly poison. For the duration, the maeragorgon's bite attack deals an additional 4 ({@damage 1d8}) poison damage on a hit, and causes the target to be {@condition poisoned} until the end of their next turn

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the maeragorgon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The maeragorgon makes three attacks: one with its bite, one with its horns, and one with its claws. When its poison breath is available, it can use the breath in place of any two of the above attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Horns
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 1d12 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Poison Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon head exhales a poisonous cloud in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 10d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The maeragorgon makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The maeragorgon makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Firey Liftoff (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The maeragorgon lifts off in a burst of flame. Each creature within 5 feet of the Maeragorgon must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage and is pushed 5 feet way from the maeragorgon. On a success, a target takes half as much damage and is not pushed. The dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

trait.name: Bloodsucker
entries: When the chupacabra hits a creature that is neither an undead nor a construct with its bite, it gains a blood dice, a {@dice d6}. The chupacabra can have up to two blood dice stored at once, and can use these dice to fuel its other abilities. Unused blood dice disappear after 1 minute.

trait.name: Rejuvenate
entries: as a bonus action, the chupacabra can roll one of its blod dice, regaining hit points equal to the number rolled.

trait.name: Rush
entries: As a bonus action, the chupacabra can roll one of its blood dice, addign five times the number rolled to its speed until the end of its turn. For the duration, the chupacabra's movement doesnt provoke opportuniy attacks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The chupacabra makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) slashing damage.

monster.name: Brass Spider

immune.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

languages: understands one language of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The brass spider has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The brass spider's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The brass spider makes three melee weapon attacks. It can use its piercing leap in place of two of the attacks.

action.name: Slash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Skewer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one {@condition prone} creature of size medium or smaller. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Until this grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained}. The brass spider can have up to two creatures {@condition grappled} in this way at once. If the brass spider moves, it releases any {@condition grappled} creatures.

If the brass spider jumps at least 10 feet as part of its movement, it can use this action to land on its feet in a space that contains one or more other creatures. Each of those creatures must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength or Dexterity saving throw (target's choice) or be knocked {@condition prone} and take 14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) piercing damage. On a successful save, the creature takes only half damage, isnt knocked {@condition prone}, and is pushed 5 feet out of the brass spider's space into an unoccupied space of the creature's choice. If no unoccupied space is within rage, the creature instead falls {@condition prone} in the bras spider's space.

monster.name: Electrum Drake

immune.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

languages: understands one language of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The iron cobra has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The electrum drake makes two attacks: one with its bite, and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Breath Weapons {@recharge}
entries: The electrum drake uses one of the following breath weapons.

items.name: Fire Breath.
items.entry: The electrum drake exhales fire in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw, taking 17 ({@damage 5d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Paralyzing Breath.
items.entry: The electrum drake exhales paralyzing gas in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Deadly Gaze
entries: When a creature that can see the cockatrice's eyes starts its turn within 30 feet of the cockatrice, the cockatrice can force it to make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw if the cockatrice isn't {@condition incapacitated} and can see the creature. The creature takes 17 ({@damage 5d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

A creature that isn't surprised can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If it does so, it can't see the basilisk until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If it looks at the basilisk in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw against being magically {@condition petrified}, making the save at disadvantage if the creature failed the save against the cockatrice's deadly gaze sicne the end of the cockatrice's last turn. On a failed save, the creature begins to turn to stone and is {@condition restrained}. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is {@condition petrified} for 24 hours.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The couatl's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The couatl makes two attacks: one with it's bite and one with it's constrict

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the couatl can't constrict another target.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: The couatl magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating equal to or less than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the couatl's choice).

In a new form, the couatl retains its game statistics and ability to speak, but its AC, movement modes, Strength, Dexterity, and other actions are replaced by those of the new form, and it gains any statistics and capabilities (except class features, legendary actions, and lair actions) that the new form has but that it lacks. If the new form has a bite attack, the couatl can use its bite in that form.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The fallen couatl's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring only verbal components:

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The quetzalcouatl's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Shielded Mind
entries: The quetzalcouatl is immune to scrying and to any effect that would sense its emotions, read its thoughts, or detect its location.

trait.name: Waxing Wind
entries: As a bonus action on its turn, the quetzalcouatl can cause a wind to develop centered on a point the quetzalcouatl can see within 60 feet of it. For the next minute or until the quetzalcouatl uses this ability again, a 20-foot radius area centered on that point

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The couatl makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its constrict or its throw. It also uses slicing wind once.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) piercing damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 24 hours. Until this poison ends, the target is {@condition unconscious}. Another creature can use an action to shake the target awake.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one Large or smaller creature. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the couatl can't constrict another target.

action.name: Throw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature {@condition grappled} by the quetzalcouatl. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is thrown up to 30 feet in a direction of the quetzalcouatl's choice.

action.name: Slicing Wind
entries: The quetzalcouatl causes the air centered on a point it can see within 60 feet of it to slice at nearby creatures. Each creature within a 5-foot radius of the point must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: The quetzalcouatl magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating equal to or less than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the quetzalcouatl's choice).

In a new form, the quetzalcouatl retains its game statistics and ability to speak, but its AC, movement modes, Strength, Dexterity, and other actions are replaced by those of the new form, and it gains any statistics and capabilities (except class features, legendary actions, and lair actions) that the new form has but that it lacks. If the new form has a bite attack, the couatl can use its bite in that form.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The quetzalcouatl's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring only verbal components:

trait.name: Crystalline Tail
entries: The crysmal's tail is made from a magical crystal the absorbs and reacts with cold, fire, and lightning. Whenever the crysmal takes cold, fire, or lightning damage, its tail becomes charged with that damage type until it becomes charged with a different one. The crysmal's tail attack deals an additional 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage of the damage type it is charged with.
Additionaly, if the crysmal is missing its tail at the start of its turn, roll a {@dice d6}. On a roll of 5-6, its tail reforms.

trait.name: Elemental Augment (1/Day)
entries: As a bonus action on its turn, the crysmal charges its tail with cold, fire, or lightning.

trait.name: Earth Glide
entries: The crysmal can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the crysmal doesn't disturb the material it moves through.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The crysmal makes three attacks: two with its claws and one with its tail.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage. If the crysmal makes a ranged attack with its tail, the tail explodes on impact, hit or miss. Each creature within 5 feet of the target, including the target, must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes the same damage as the inital attack on a failed asve, or half as much damage on a successful one. The crysmal is then unable to make tail attacks until its tail reforms.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The crysmal's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Poor Depth Perception
entries: The cyclops has disadvantage on any attack roll against a target more than 30 ft. away.

action.name: Greatclub
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature of size Medium or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14})

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Eye Rays
entries: As a bonus action, the cyclops can begin charging its eye with infernal energy, causing its iris to glow with red light. At the start of its next turn, the light dissipates and the cyclops releases a beam of fire from its eye along a line 5 feet wide and 90 feet long, stopping early if the line intersects with a solid surface. If the beam intersects with a creature, that creature must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 45 ({@damage 10d8}) fire damage, and the beam stops traveling. On a successful save, the creature takes no damage and the beam continues travelling, potentially intersecting with another target. A creature can choose to intentionally fail the save. If the beam strikes an object or surface, it deals 45 28 ({@damage 10d8}) fire damage to whatever it struck.

trait.name: Poor Depth Perception
entries: The cyclops has disadvantage on any attack roll against a target more than 30 ft. away.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The cyclops has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cyclops makes three attacks: one with its bite, one with its club, and one with its whip. Alternatively, it can make two attacks with its whip.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) piercing damage and the target must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} until the end of their next turn. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage and is not {@condition poisoned}.

action.name: Club
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d4 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Whip
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d4 + 7}) slashing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage.

action.name: Stunning Shriek {@recharge 5}
entries: The cyclops releases an unnaturally high-pitched shriek. Each creature within 30 feet of the cyclops that can hear the shriek must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the cyclop's next turn.

trait.name: Blood Scent
entries: The cyclops can sense the location of any creature within 30 feet of it that has half its hit points or fewer, allowing it to ignore invisibility and sniff out creatures outside its field of view. The cyclops cannot sense creatures without blood, like constructs, elementals, and some types of undead.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The cyclops has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Poor Depth Perception
entries: The cyclops has disadvantage on any attack roll against a target more than 30 ft. away.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cyclops makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
